page.title: 18RECREATION 1
page.content: Country sports play a great part in the recreational facility of the area. The Grove and Rufford Hunt regularly use the land as they pursue their quarry.No great opposition to fox hunting exists and relations with the hunt are good.The hunt dogs are kept at Barnby Moor Kennels. Pheasant and partridges are bred as game birds and then left to populate the woods and fields.Organized shoot take place during the shooting season.Any pests are also shot,for example,rabbit,foxes and pigeons. Many bridal paths and public footpaths criss cross the area and are regularly trod by enthusiastic ramblers and horse riders.The local rambling club ensures that these paths are kept open by arranging regular vigilante walks. Orienteering occasionally takes place in the nearby forests.
